meanings.definition: Relating to the study of rock layers and their relationships.
meanings.sent1: The stratigraphical research helped scientists understand the history of the rocks.
meanings.sent2: Geologists use stratigraphical methods to determine the age of different rock layers.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphical investigation revealed the secrets hidden within the ancient stones.
meanings.sent4: Her stratigraphical approach to the problem allowed her to uncover hidden patterns.
meanings.sent5: The stratigraphical analysis painted a vivid picture of the Earth's geological past.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the arrangement of sedimentary rock layers.
meanings.sent1: The stratigraphical formations showed the different sedimentary layers clearly.
meanings.sent2: The stratigraphical characteristics of the rocks indicated their formation over time.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphical patterns in the rocks resembled a layered cake.
meanings.sent4: His stratigraphical map illustrated the sedimentary rock layers beautifully.
meanings.sent5: The stratigraphical features of the cliffs revealed the history of the land.

meanings.definition: Involving the analysis of the order and position of rock strata.
meanings.sent1: The stratigraphical study focused on understanding the sequence of rock layers.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used stratigraphical techniques to determine the relative positions of the strata.
meanings.sent3: The stratigraphical examination of the quarry revealed unexpected layering.
meanings.sent4: His stratigraphical approach to the project helped him organize the data effectively.
meanings.sent5: The stratigraphical investigation uncovered the intricate arrangement of the rock strata.
